thread.title: Science with Chris Smith: paralysed man walks again
thread.title_full: Science with Chris Smith: paralysed man walks again

author: ABC Radio National
title: Science with Chris Smith: paralysed man walks again
text:
Friday 25 September 2015 6:35AM (view full episode) 
We all know why spinal injuries can be so devastating: if you sever your spinal chord, the brain's messages to your legs can't get through â€” leaving you paralysed. 
A 26 year old man paralysed from the chest down has been able to walk again thanks to an artificial, man-made interface between his brain and his leg muscles. 
It's a complex matrix of electrodes woven into a cap that sits on your head. 
For more, Fran Kelly is joined by RN Breakfast 's science correspondent Chris Smith with all the latest news from the world of science.
